Detailed Description

Interface for mcd files.

This is the entry point to all other MC_Stream interfaces

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CMCSAStreamFile::CMCSAStreamFile (  ) 

constructor

if you use the COM interface, you would create an object for example like: 

        CComPtr<MCStream::IMCSStreamFile> IMcdFile;
        HRESULT hres = IMcdFile.CoCreateInstance(_bstr_t("MCSTREAM.MCSSTRM"));

Member Function Documentation

short CMCSAStreamFile::CloseFile (  ) 

Close MC_Rack data file.

Closes the MC_Rack file, deletes the stream objects and the MCSHdr structure.

Returns:
  • 0 = OK

long CMCSAStreamFile::GetRecordingMode (  )  [virtual]

Get recording mode.

MC_Rack data can either be continuous or triggered (sweeps). For triggered data the sweeps are of the same length (start on trigger and a fixed cut out interval)

Returns:
mode:
  • 0 for continuous
  • 1 for triggered start
short CMCSAStreamFile::GetSecond (  )  [virtual]

Get Second component of recording start time.

Returns:
Second component of recording start time
long CMCSAStreamFile::GetSoftwareVersionMajor (  )  [virtual]

Get MC_Rack software version major part.

Returns:
software version (major part) of the recording software with which the mcd file was recorded. This is a 4 byte value. The first two bytes indicate the major part of the version, the lower bytes the minor part
Example 
int swMajor = m_IStreamFile->GetSoftwareVersionMajor();
int swMajor1 = swMajor >> 16;
int swMajor2 = swMajor & 0x0000FFFF;
long CMCSAStreamFile::GetSoftwareVersionMinor (  )  [virtual]

Get MC_Rack software version minor part.

See also:
GetSoftwareVersionMajor()
Returns:
software version (minor part) of the recording software with which the mcd file was recorded.
short CMCSAStreamFile::GetSourceType (  )  [virtual]
Returns:
mode:
  • 0 for Plain layout
  • 1 for MEA layout
  • 2 for double Mea Layout
  • 3 for unknown layout.
CMCSATimeStamp * CMCSAStreamFile::GetStartTime (  )  [virtual]

Get start time.

The start time is the time point of the first data sample.

Returns:
Time stamp of the first data sample.
CMCSATimeStamp * CMCSAStreamFile::GetStopTime (  )  [virtual]

Get stop time.

the stop time is the time stamp of the last data sample.

Returns:
Time stamp of the last data sample.

long CMCSAStreamFile::GetStreamCount (  )  [virtual]

Get number of data streams of the currenly opened data file.

Data stream are electrode raw data, filtered data, digital data, spikes, and so on.

Returns:
number of data streams
int CMCSAStreamFile::GetSweepCount (  )  [virtual]

Get the number of sweeps.

If the number of sweeps is larger than 0, the data is stored as sweeps (and not continuous) in the file. The return value is the actual number of sweeps. 

long lSweepCount = m_MCSFile.GetSweepCount();
if(lSweepCount > 0)
{
    long lSweepLength = m_MCSFile.GetSweepLength();
    
    for(long sc = 0; sc < lStreamCount; ++sc)
    {
        // create stream object
        m_MCSStream.AttachDispatch(m_MCSFile.GetStream(sc));
        CString csBufferID = m_MCSStream.GetBufferID();

        if((csBufferID.Find("elec") != -1) ||
            (csBufferID.Find("filt") != -1) ||
            (csBufferID.Find("anlg") != -1) ||
            (csBufferID.Find("digi") != -1))
        {
            for(long sweep = 0; sweep < lSweepCount; ++sweep)
            {
                IMCSTimeStamp SweepStart;
                LPDISPATCH lpd = m_MCSFile.GetSweepStartTimeAt(i);
                SweepStart.AttachDispatch(lpd);
                int iSeconds = SweepStart.GetSecondFromStart();
                int iMilliS = SweepStart.GetMillisecondFromStart();
                int iMicroS = SweepStart.GetMicrosecondFromStart();
                int iNanoS = SweepStart.GetNanosecondFromStart();
                SweepStart.ReleaseDispatch();
                __int64 i64RecordingTime =  static_cast<__int64>(iSeconds) * 1000000 +
                                                                        static_cast<__int64>(iMilliS) * 1000 +
                                                                        static_cast<__int64>(iMicroS);

                long lSweepSize = m_MCSStream.GetSweepRawDataBufferSize(lSweep);
                short* pMCDBuffer = new short [lSweepSize];
                if(lSweepSize != m_MCSStream.GetSweepRawData(pMCDBuffer, lSweep))
                {
                    AfxMessageBox("Error reading Sweep");
                    return false;
                }
            }
        }
        m_MCSStream.ReleaseDispatch();
    }       
}
Returns:
number of recorded sweeps

CMCSATimeStamp * CMCSAStreamFile::GetTimeStampStartPressed (  )  [virtual]

Get time stamp of start pressed.

Time stamp when sart button was pressed. For continuous data it is very close to the time of the fist data sample, but for triggered data both values may differ enormously.

See also:
GetStartTime().
Returns:
Time stamp when start button was pressed
short CMCSAStreamFile::GetYear (  )  [virtual]

Get Year component of recording start time.

Returns:
Year component of recording start time
FileOpenResult CMCSAStreamFile::OpenFile ( LPCTSTR  szFileName  ) 

Open MC_Rack data file (mcd file).

Open a MC_Rack data file, and read the file header, which contains info about the file, the recorded data streams and channels.

Note:
If you use the COM interface, use OpenFileEx()
Parameters:
szFileName The complete path to the mcd file
Returns:
File open error code
  • 0 = OK
  • 1 = File can not be opened.
  • 2 = Wrong file format.
  • 3 = Wrong file header.
  • 4 = Empty data file.
